message:
Are there any java developers who wrote applications that deals with SQL Server database ?

is it normal that update operations take too much time ? Are there any suggestion , tips , recommended way to connect java code to sql server to do some insertion and update operations. Thanks in advance.

data.message: Have you gone enough profiling to see where the time is being spent? Whether it is in the SQL Server stack or the Java stack or network?
nope , how could I do this ?
Use SQL Profiler from Tools menu in management studio or from start menu. Start a session and try the scenario that takes long time. This will give you an idea if the problem in the sql server stack.
SQL server itself is working fine. The problem appears when I try to connect java with sql server in Netbeans. The update operation takes too much time

You can't improve what you can't measure, you need to profile first to see how much time is being spent for executing the update statement, and then do a change for example add an index or modify the statement and profile again and see if that really helped
I though u mean a specific tool but now I get what u mean
SQL profiler as Adel K. Khalil said is the way to go, but this will only measure SQL server time, if the problem is somewhere else you will need another tool for that.
